excerpt: Vast archaeological site with ancient temples, ruins of Akragas city & a museum designed by Minissi.
detail_description: Valley of the Temples is a vast archaeological site in Sicily, featuring ancient temples and ruins of the city of Akragas. The city, known as Agrigentum to the Romans, was situated on a high plateau with a panoramic view. It boasted exceptional prosperity and magnificence, attracting foreign visitors.
name: Valley of the Temples

excerpt: Agrigento is a hilltop city on Sicily's southwest shore. It's known for the ruins of the ancient city of Akragas in the Valley of the Temples, a vast archaeological site with well-preserved Greek temples. On the modern city's outskirts is the Museo Archeologico Regionale 'Pietro Griffo', with artifacts and a telamon (giant male figure). West lies Scala dei Turchi, a stepped white cliff overlooking sandy beaches.
detail_description: Agrigento, a hilltop city on Sicily's southwest shore, is renowned for the well-preserved Greek temples in the Valley of the Temples. The Museo Archeologico Regionale 'Pietro Griffo' showcases artifacts and a giant male figure. Nearby lies Scala dei Turchi, a white cliff overlooking sandy beaches.
name: Agrigento

excerpt: Archaeology museum displaying Greek artifacts excavated from the surrounding Valley of the Temples.
detail_description: The Archaeological Museum "Pietro Griffo" of Agrigento is situated near the West Entrance of the Valley of the Temples. It's named after Pietro Griffo, an Italian archeologist, and it houses a diverse collection of artifacts such as ceramics, sculptures, coins, and jewelry. These items offer a comprehensive insight into the historical and cultural legacy of the region.
name: Archaeological Museum "Pietro Griffo" of Agrigento
address: Contrada San Nicola, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: In the heart of Agrigento, Italy, lies the Chiesa di Santa Maria dei Greci, a Norman church with a rich history. Constructed on the grounds of an ancient Greek temple dating back to the 5th century BC, this site has witnessed various rulers and cultural influences over time. The church features well-preserved Norman wooden ceilings and Byzantine frescoes that offer a glimpse into its storied past.
name: Chiesa di Santa Maria dei Greci
address: Salita Santa Maria dei Greci, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: In downtown Agrigento, you'll find the Theatro Luigi Pirandello, a historic theater located at the entrance to the town hall. This architectural gem was built in 1870 and has been a prominent cultural venue in the city. It's not just a beautiful building; it also hosts theatrical events that visitors can enjoy. The theater is named after Luigi Pirandello, a renowned writer and Nobel laureate known for his novels and plays.
name: Theatre Luigi Pirandello
address: P.za Luigi Pirandello, 35, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: The Monache cistercensi di Santo Spirito, also known as the Abbey Church and Convent of the Holy Spirit, is a remarkable example of medieval art and Chiaramonte style in Sicily. It stands as one of the most captivating monuments in Agrigento's historical center. The monastery is home to cloistered nuns who continue to preserve ancient recipes from the convent's bakery, including almond macaroons, couscous, and other sweet treats.
name: Monache Cistercensi di Santo Spirito
address: Cortile Santo Spirito, 9 8, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

excerpt: Archaeological site featuring the remains of a large Greek temple, including toppled stone atlases.
detail_description: The Temple of Olympian Zeus is an impressive archaeological site featuring the remains of a large Greek temple, including toppled stone atlases. The park also houses various historical structures such as the monumental pyramid-shaped Tomb of Terone, three shrines, a Hellenistic-Roman district, and the Giambertoni necropolis.
name: Temple of Olympian Zeus

detail_description: Chiesa di San Lorenzo detta del Purgatorio, also known as Purgatory Church, was finished in 1761 and funded by a prosperous neighborhood. The church boasts a magnificent reddish-golden tufa facade with a white doorway framed by twisted columns. Inside, visitors can admire deep-relief stuccoes created in the late 1600s by Giacomo Serpotta, a prominent figure of the Sicilian Baroque style.
name: Chiesa di San Lorenzo detta del Purgatorio
address: Via Atenea-piazzetta Purgatorio, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: Via Atenea is a bustling street in Agrigento, Italy, known for its vibrant atmosphere and historical landmarks. Surrounding attractions include Teatro Pirandello, the Viale, and the Greek amphitheater. Additionally, visitors can explore the famous Valley of the Temples nearby, offering stunning views of Agrigento and the Mediterranean Sea.
name: Via Atenea

detail_description: Scalinata degli Artisti is a unique and colorful staircase located in Agrigento, Sicily. Each step features messages in different languages, while street art adorns the stairs and nearby walls. This spot is a product of the non-profit organization Culturart and has been recognized as one of the 16 most colorful staircases globally. Visitors can also find a smaller staircase decorated like piano keys nearby.
name: Scalinata degli Artisti

detail_description: Cathedral City Center is a vibrant and bustling area in the heart of Sicily, just a short 20-minute drive from the stunning Scala dei Turchi cliffs. This central location offers easy access to the city's main attractions, including historic cathedrals, charming cafes, and lively markets. Visitors can immerse themselves in the rich culture and architecture of this picturesque destination while being within reach of the breathtaking natural wonders that surround it.
name: Cathedral City Center
address: Via S. Vincenzo, 30, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

excerpt: Centuries-old olive trees & orange blossoms, plus tours of Ancient Greek underground chambers.
detail_description: Nestled in the Valley of the Temples, Giardino della Kolymbethra is a centuries-old oasis featuring ancient olive trees, fragrant orange blossoms, and traditional citrus gardens. Managed by the heritage organization FAI, this charming garden offers a refreshing contrast to the surrounding temple landscape. Visitors can explore the living museum of almond trees and learn about ancient Greek underground chambers through guided tours. While there is an additional charge for entry, UK National Trust members enjoy free admission.
name: Giardino della Kolymbethra
address: Viale Caduti di Marzabotto, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

excerpt: Grand, historic Catholic church with elaborate, art-covered ceilings & a massive pipe organ.
detail_description: Cattedrale di San Gerlando is a grand Catholic church located at the highest point of Agrigento. This historic landmark boasts elaborate, art-covered ceilings and is renowned for its massive pipe organ. Originally built in the 12th century as a mosque, it was later converted into a Christian church after the Norman conquest of Sicily. The cathedral showcases fine examples of Norman-style architecture and has undergone various expansions and renovations over the centuries, resulting in a unique blend of architectural styles.
name: Cattedrale di San Gerlando
address: Piazza Don Giovanni Minzoni, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: Viale della Vittoria is a charming and picturesque street located in the heart of a vibrant city. Lined with beautiful trees and elegant buildings, it offers a delightful setting for leisurely strolls and sightseeing. The avenue is known for its lively atmosphere, with bustling cafes, boutique shops, and cultural landmarks that reflect the city's rich heritage.
name: Viale della Vittoria
Casuzza al Duomo con vista Valle dei Templi!

detail_description: Casa Natale di Luigi Pirandello e Tomba is a captivating destination for literature enthusiasts, located just 5 km southwest of Agrigento. This elegant villa, where the Nobel Prize-winning playwright and author was born, offers visitors a glimpse into his life through an array of memorabilia, photographs, and original manuscripts. The charming surroundings provide a serene atmosphere to explore the rooms filled with family history and literary treasures.
name: Casa Natale di Luigi Pirandello e Tomba

detail_description: Mudia_Museo Diocesan Agrigento is a captivating religious museum that takes visitors on a wonderful journey through various paintings depicting stories of the Almighty from the Cathedral of Agrigento. It houses artifacts dating back to the Norman age, adding significant historical value. The museum staff are professional and provide insights into the cathedral's thousand-year history and preserved relics. Due to ongoing consolidation works at the cathedral, many artworks have been transferred to this museum for preservation and ease of exploration by tourists.
name: Mudia_Museo Diocesan Agrigento
Fabbriche Chiaramontane
address: Via San Francesco d'Assisi, 1, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: The Museum of the Filippini, formerly known as the ex Collegio dei Filippini, is a must-visit destination for art enthusiasts. This 17th-century museum houses a remarkable collection of paintings spanning from the 14th to the 18th century. Visitors can admire artworks that showcase various artistic styles and periods. One particular artist not to be missed is Francesco Lojacono, renowned for his exquisite Sicilian landscape paintings in the 18th century.
name: Ex Collegio dei Filippini

detail_description: Discover the mesmerizing world of precious gems at Gems Museum, where you can marvel at the glittering beauty of various gemstones. Take a guided tour led by experts who will share insights into the formation and significance of these gems in jewelry. Learn about the intricate processes involved in creating pearls and witness how these exquisite treasures are carefully retrieved, processed, and perfected for adornment.
name: Gems Museum
address: Via Papa Luciani, 37, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: Sal8 is a restaurant that offers an exceptional dining experience. The interior is modern and of high quality, blending history and modernity with delightful color combinations. The atmosphere is relaxed, with pleasant background music that doesn't disrupt conversations. The service is top-notch, with extremely friendly and courteous waitstaff. Guests feel comfortable and valued in this clean and well-maintained establishment.
name: Sal8
address: Via Cesare Battisti, 8, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: The Temple of the Dioscuri is part of a larger archaeological site that includes several other ancient temples and sanctuaries. The temple is located in the western sector, alongside other majestic structures like the Temple of Herakles, Temple of Juno, and Temple of Olympian Zeus. Although the temple itself was destroyed, its preserved edges still give an idea of its original shape.
name: Temple of the Dioscuri

detail_description: Via Ugo La Malfa is the location for Agrigento's bustling market, which takes place every Friday from 08:00 to 13:00. The market offers a diverse range of products at budget-friendly prices. Visitors can explore an extensive space filled with stalls selling fresh food, local culinary delights, home and garden accessories, as well as clothing.
name: V. Ugo La Malfa

detail_description: Villa San Marco is a charming bed and breakfast nestled in the heart of Agrigento's Valley of the Temples, just 500 meters from the ancient Greek temples. The rustic-style, air-conditioned rooms offer free Wi-Fi, and guests can enjoy a large garden with a swimming pool. This family-run establishment provides unique and enthusiastic hospitality, with personalized catering available for breakfast. Guests praise the stunning beauty of the villa and its surroundings, highlighting its peaceful atmosphere and breathtaking views of the valley.
name: Villa San Marco
Terracotta cucina naturale
address: Via Luigi Pirandello, 1, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

excerpt: Reinvented Sicilian cuisine with a focus on seasonality at an 1800s palazzo with balcony tables.
detail_description: La Scala is a popular Italian restaurant with a focus on seasonal cuisine that takes place in an 1800s palazzo. The restaurant has balcony tables and serves lunch and dinner. Alcohol is available, and the full bar features wine and beer. Credit cards are accepted, as well as American Express, Mastercard, and Visa. There is free wifi throughout the restaurant.
name: Ristorante La Scala

detail_description: The Hellenistic-Roman Quarter in the Temples Valley is a fascinating site featuring the remains of ancient residential areas adorned with mosaic floor tiles. A visit to the museum allows you to see recreations of the Temple of Zeus and Gigante, showcasing its former grandeur as the largest known Greek temple in the world.
name: Hellenistic - Roman Quarter - Temples Valley

detail_description: The Church of San Pietro is a stunning architectural gem that dates back to the latter half of the 18th century, built on the site of an earlier church. Although it has been deconsecrated and now serves as a conference hall, its impressive facade continues to captivate visitors. Nestled near charming spots like Piazza Purgatorio and surrounded by Baroque balconies, this church offers not only a glimpse into history but also breathtaking views from the adjacent square.
name: Church of San Pietro
address: Via Luigi Pirandello, 2, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

excerpt: Posh hotel featuring a bar, a gym & a garden, as well as an outdoor pool, a restaurant & a spa.
detail_description: Hotel Villa Athena is a luxurious 5-star property located in the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Valley of the Temples in Agrigento, Italy. This posh hotel offers a range of amenities including a bar, gym, garden, outdoor pool, restaurant and spa. The 18th-century villa provides stunning views of the ancient Temple of Concordia from its restaurant and some rooms. Surrounded by olive groves and farm, it offers an illusion of seclusion amidst the ruins.
name: Hotel Villa Athena
address: Via Passeggiata Archeologica, 33, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: Located on the Via Atenea near Porta Atenea in Agrigento, the Statua Andrea Camilleri is a tribute to the late writer who passed away in 2019. The statue depicts Camilleri seated at a bar table with an empty chair, allowing visitors to sit and take photos with him. This spot offers a unique opportunity for fans of his famous Inspector Montalbano series to capture a memorable moment.
name: Statua Andrea Camilleri
address: Piazzetta dello Scrittore, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: Naif is a popular restaurant in Agrigento, known for its delicious food and great ambiance. Visitors have praised the sophisticated dining experience and highlighted the use of basic flavors without overwhelming seasoning. The menu features delectable dishes such as Caponata, mussels soup, Polpa griglia with lemon-infused potato mash, and squid stuffed with Sicilian cous-cous. Guests also enjoyed pairing their meals with local white wine like Aquilae Grillo.
name: Ristorante Naif

detail_description: Piazzale Ugo La Malfa is a vibrant hub in Agrigento, especially known for its lively market every Friday from 08:00 to 13:00. Here, visitors can explore an array of products at budget-friendly prices. The area also serves as a convenient parking spot for those looking to stroll up the hill into the charming town of Agrigento.
name: PARCHEGGIO PIAZZALE UGO LA MALFA

detail_description: Nestled within the charming labyrinth of Agrigento Old Town, Casa Tita is a delightful retreat that perfectly blends style and comfort. This cozy haven boasts exposed-brick walls, vibrant abstract art, and retro furnishings that create an inviting atmosphere. Guests can expect thoughtful amenities like two televisions with Netflix, quality toiletries, plush towels, and even slippers for added comfort.
name: Casa Tita
address: Salita F. Sala, 2, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

excerpt: Imposing remains of the 5th-century BCE Greek temple of Juno (Hera), with 30 columns still standing.
name: Tempio di Giunone

excerpt: Ancient, preserved Greek temple on a hill, with Doric architecture & interpretive information.
detail_description: The Temple of Concordia in Agrigento, Sicily is a well-preserved ancient Greek temple with Doric architecture. It is part of a larger site that includes eight temples and various other remains, all located in the same area. The temple itself is considered one of the world's best-preserved Doric temples and offers a romantic setting amidst wildflower-dotted landscapes with distant views of the sea. Visitors can explore the site on foot or take a minibus for convenience.
name: Temple of Concordia, Agrigento

detail_description: Punta Bianca Beach (Monte Grande) is a hidden gem located in the southern coast of Sicily, just 20 minutes south from Agrigento. Accessible via a bumpy road, this rocky spur offers stunning views and a rugged natural setting with sandy and pebble coves surrounded by dwarf palms and sea lilies. While the road to reach the beach may be challenging for regular cars, it's worth the effort for nature enthusiasts seeking an off-the-beaten-path experience.
name: Riserva Naturale di Punta Bianca

detail_description: Nestled on a hill that offers breathtaking views of the Valley of Temples, St. Nicholas Church is a remarkable Gothic structure dating back to 200 AD. Its unfinished facade features pointed arches and an interior with a single nave adorned by four chapels, one housing an exquisite Roman sarcophagus embellished with intricate bas-reliefs.
name: St. Nicholas Church
address: Via Passeggiata Archeologica, 20, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: The Temple of Vulcano (Hefestos) is a part of the archaeological park of the Valley of the Temples, a UNESCO World Heritage site. The temple complex includes other impressive structures like the Temple of Juno, Hercules, Olympian Zeus, Castor and Pollux, and Asclepius. Exploring this vast area on foot can take several hours due to its awe-inspiring beauty.
name: Temple of Vulcano (Hefestos)
San Leone
address: d, Viale delle Dune, 47, Dune AG, Italy

excerpt: Street murals, funky installations & exhibitions in the winding alleys of a once-abandoned town.
detail_description: Cultural Park Farm is a unique destination located in the historic city center, featuring street murals, funky installations, and exhibitions set within the winding alleys of a once-abandoned town. This art gallery spans seven courtyards and showcases permanent contemporary art exhibitions and installations, artist residences, spaces for socializing and temporary living, as well as areas for conferences and concerts. The park also boasts a secret garden waiting to be discovered.
name: CULTURAL PARK FARM

detail_description: The visit to Raffaele La Scala Maestro Carradore, a handicraft museum in Sicily, offers a unique and unparalleled experience. It provides insights into the extensive craftsmanship involved in constructing traditional carts. The knowledgeable staff, led by Mr. Marcello and his wife, are extremely friendly and provide comprehensive explanations while keeping visitors engaged. Their passion for preserving this endangered tradition is evident throughout the museum.
name: Raffaele La Scala Maestro Carradore
address: Via Cavaleri Magazzeni, 38, 92100 Villaggio Mos AG, Italy

detail_description: The Collezione La Gaipa museum houses an extensive collection of art and artifacts. It showcases a diverse array of exhibits that include paintings, sculptures, and historical objects. The museum offers visitors the opportunity to explore and appreciate various artistic movements and cultural treasures. With its broad range of pieces on display, the institution provides a comprehensive overview of different artistic styles throughout history. Patrons can delve into the rich heritage preserved within these walls and gain valuable insights into human creativity through the ages.
name: Collezione La Gaipa
address: Via delle Viole, 2 San Leone, 92100 Villaggio Mos AG, Italy

name: Lido Zingarello
address: 92100 Agrigento, Free municipal consortium of Agrigento, Italy

detail_description: The sculpture of Montalbano, located in Via Roma, Porto Empedocle, Agrigento, is a remarkable piece of art that depicts the famous fictional detective. This artistic creation stands as a testament to the cultural richness and artistic expression found in this charming town. The statue serves as an attraction for visitors who are captivated by its beauty and attention to detail.
name: Statua Di Montalbano, Via Roma, Porto Empedocle, Agrigento
address: Via Roma e, Via Barresi, 92014 Porto Empedocle AG, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Sicily, the Museo Archeologico Salvatore Lauricella is a hidden gem that promises an enriching experience for all visitors. The museum boasts a remarkable collection of unique archaeological artifacts, many of which have garnered attention from international universities due to their historical significance. During my visit, I had the pleasure of meeting Mr. Carmelo Sazio, the dedicated caretaker who passionately guided us through the exhibits with warmth and expertise.
name: Museo Archeologico Salvatore Lauricella
address: Corso della Repubblica, 27, 92029 Ravanusa AG, Italy

detail_description: Mokrito is a captivating destination that beautifully marries history with modern charm. As you wander through its streets, you'll encounter the impressive Porta di Ponte, a gate from the XI Century that showcases Neo-classical architecture after its 19th-century reconstruction. This gateway leads to Via Atenea, once the heart of ancient Girgenti and now a delightful promenade lined with quaint shops and inviting restaurants.
name: Mokrito

detail_description: The Paleochristian necropolis, a significant historical site in the NICE area, is an ancient burial ground with immense cultural and religious importance. This landmark holds great significance due to its association with early Christian communities and their burial practices. The necropolis serves as a testament to the rich historical heritage of the region, showcasing ancient tombs and grave structures that provide insights into the past.
name: Paleochristian necropolis
